result.execSummary:
All charges against Trevis James Rothschadl in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Trevis James Rothschadl is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevis James Rothschadl

records.addlTxt:
2:32 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Trevis James Rothschadl in court. Attorney Aaron A. Nelson in court for Trevis James Rothschadl. INCLUDES 22CF578, 22CM333 and 22CM384. ADA Ballo recites agreement. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 - Sending Obscene/Sexually Explicit Electronic Messages in 22CF578 and Ct 1 - Disorderly Conduct w/ modifier in 22CM333. DE sworn. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 - Sending Obscene/Sexually Explicit Electronic Messages in 22CF578 and Ct 1 - Disorderly Conduct w/ modifier in 22CM333. On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses and reads in Cts 2,3,4 and 5 in 22CM578 and case 22CM384 in it's entirety. Sentencing arguments. Defendant advised of appeal rights. Adjourned: 2:54 PM. kma

Court orders:

Ct 1 - Sending Obscene/Sexually Explicit Electronic Messages
S/W 18 months probation with conditions:
- Maintain absolute sobriety

- No contact with Elizabeth S.
- No abusive contact with Jackie B.
- Comply with mental health treatment plan
- No unsupervised contact with minors under age 18, except as authorized by Agent
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections 
- Court Costs $243; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through Clerk of Court

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 089070,
Payable Number: 244618,
Receipt Number: 22R 012252,
Amount: $20.00

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, J. Ejornton & E. Severson.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
